Term.Name: Default
Term.Definition: Default audio take. There are no additional marks.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: NoGood
Term.Definition: Indicates a defective audio take e.g. disturbing noise or bloopers.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: FalseStart
Term.Definition: This may indicate that another file could exist with the same take number. Typically this file might also be marked as "NOGOOD".
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: WildTrack
Term.Definition: The take has no linked video, e.g. for some ambient recording or a alternative recording of a special dialogue part (e.g. a loud scream)
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Pickup
Term.Definition: The take does not contain any action. Its purpose is to fill occuring gaps.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Rehearsal
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: Announcement
Term.Definition: The take contains announcements from a crewmember e.g. a preceding scene description by the director.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project

Term.Name: SoundGuide
Term.Definition: Delivers an audio track as an orientation for further processes.
Term.ChangeComment: First version within the Dwerft project
